docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the community service program AmeriCorps have been told that their government-provided insurance did not meet the requirements of the new health law.

headline.main: Vista Workers Told Their U.S. Health Plan Fails Test
headline.print_headline: Vista Workers Told Their U.S. Health Plan Fails Test

docs.abstract: Obama administration tells Vista volunteers and other AmeriCorp workers that their government-provided health coverage does not measure up to standards of Affordable Care Act, and that they may be subject to financial penalties unless they obtain insurance elsewhere.
docs.snippet: Members of the community service program AmeriCorps have been told that their government-provided insurance did not meet the requirements of the new health law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Corp for National and Community Service
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans were bracing for a Monday deadline to sign up for health insurance, after a series of changes that has caused uncertainty among insurers and confusion among consumers.

headline.main: Mixed Messages Add Anxiety as Deadline Nears in Health Act
headline.print_headline: Momentum Amid Uncertainty as Deadline for Health Care Enrollment Nears

docs.abstract: Obama administration's decision to delay some of health care law's most important provisions and to extend some deadlines beyond January 1 enrollment deadline has caused uncertainty among insurers and confusion among consumers.
docs.snippet: Americans were bracing for a Monday deadline to sign up for health insurance, after a series of changes that has caused uncertainty among insurers and confusion among consumers.
